title: Pro-Brexit supporters clash with police at London's Parliament Square - video
text:
Pro-Brexit activists hurled abuse and scrapped with police as they attempted to disrupt an anti-Brexit rally in London.



Crowds had gathered to protest against 'Boris Johnson’s coup against the democratic process' and heard speeches from figures including anti-Brexit MP Anna Soubry and Owen Jones.

However, scores of pro-Brexit counter-protesters attempted to provoke those assembled with chants and banners.

The Metropolitan police confirmed that there had been skirmishes and said 16 arrests had been made in connection with the protests in Westminster, mainly for violent disorder, but also for possession of an offensive weapon and a racially aggravated public order offence
description: Pro-Brexit activists hurled abuse and scrapped with police as they attempted to disrupt a 'stop the coup' rally in London
